Chapter 14, Part 2: The Great Vehicle Armor, First Part
At that time, SubhÅ«ti addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!
According to my understanding of the meaning spoken by the Buddha, a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva does not don the armor of merit. One should know that this is donning the armor of the Great Vehicle.
Why is it so?
Because the intrinsic characteristics of all dharmas are empty.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One!
Form is empty in the characteristics of form, and feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are empty in the characteristics of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness;

The eye sense base is empty in the characteristics of the eye sense base, and the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases are empty in the characteristics of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases;

The form sense base is empty in the characteristics of the form sense base, and the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma sense bases are empty in the characteristics of the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma sense bases;

The eye element is empty of the intrinsic nature of the eye element; the form element, eye-consciousness element, and eye contact, as well as the feelings that arise from eye contact conditioned by eye contact, are empty of the intrinsic nature of the feelings that arise from eye contact conditioned by eye contact.

The ear element is empty of the intrinsic nature of the ear element; the sound element, ear-consciousness element, and ear contact, as well as the feelings that arise from ear contact conditioned by ear contact, are empty of the intrinsic nature of the feelings that arise from ear contact conditioned by ear contact.

The nose element is empty of the intrinsic nature of the nose element; the smell element, nose-consciousness element, and nose contact, as well as the feelings that arise from nose contact conditioned by nose contact, are empty of the intrinsic nature of the feelings that arise from nose contact conditioned by nose contact.

The tongue element is empty of the intrinsic nature of the tongue element; the taste element, tongue-consciousness element, and tongue contact, as well as the feelings that arise from tongue contact conditioned by tongue contact, are empty of the intrinsic nature of the feelings that arise from tongue contact conditioned by tongue contact.

the body element and the body element are empty of the characteristics of the body element, the tactile objects element, the body consciousness element, and the body contact and the tactile objects element and the body contact as a condition for the arising of sensations are empty of the characteristics of the tactile objects element and the body contact as a condition for the arising of sensations;

the mind element and the mind element are empty of the characteristics of the mind element, the dharma element, the mind consciousness element, and the mind contact and the mind contact as a condition for the arising of sensations are empty of the characteristics of the dharma element and the mind contact as a condition for the arising of sensations;

the earth element and the earth element are empty of the characteristics of the earth element, the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements are empty of the characteristics of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements;

the noble truth of suffering and the noble truth of suffering are empty of the characteristics of the noble truth of suffering, the noble truth of the arising of suffering, the noble truth of the cessation of suffering, and the noble truth of the path to the cessation of suffering are empty of the characteristics of the noble truth of the arising of suffering, the noble truth of the cessation of suffering, and the noble truth of the path to the cessation of suffering;

ignorance and ignorance are empty of the characteristics of ignorance, the volitional formations, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, sensation, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress are empty of the characteristics of old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress;

The emptiness of internal phenomena is empty of the characteristics of the emptiness of internal phenomena, and the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the great emptiness, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-disappearance, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of essential nature, the emptiness of essential nature with respect to non-apprehension, and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-apprehension are empty of the characteristics of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-apprehension.ğŸ”½The four meditative states are empty of the characteristics of the four meditative states, and the four immeasurable aspirations and the four formless concentrations are empty of the characteristics of the four immeasurable aspirations and the four formless concentrations.

The four establishments of mindfulness are empty of the characteristics of the four establishments of mindfulness, and the four right efforts, the four bases of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, and the eightfold noble path are empty of the characteristics of the four right efforts up to the eightfold noble path.

The emptiness of the gate of emptiness of the gate of emptiness, the signlessness of the gate of signlessness of the gate of signlessness, the wishlessness of the gate of wishlessness of the gate of wishlessness;
The emptiness of the perfection of giving of the perfection of giving, the emptiness of morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom of morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom;
The emptiness of the five eyes of the five eyes, the emptiness of the six supernormal knowledges of the six supernormal knowledges;

The emptiness of the ten powers of the ten powers of the Buddha, the emptiness of the four fearlessnesses, four unhindered understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha, omniscience, knowledge of the aspects of the path, and knowledge of all aspects of the four fearlessnesses up to knowledge of all aspects;
The emptiness of the bodhisattva of the bodhisattva, the emptiness of the armor of merit of the armor of merit.
World-Honored One!
For this reason, the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva does not don the armor of merit. One should know that this is donning the armor of the Great Vehicle.
The Buddha told SubhÅ«ti:ğŸ”½It is so!
It is so!
As you have said.
SubhÅ«ti, you should know!

The wisdom of omniscience is without creation and without action, and all sentient beings are also without creation and without action. The bodhisattva-mahÄsattva dons the armor of the Great Vehicle for this very reason.
The Venerable SubhÅ«ti addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!

For what causes and conditions is the wisdom of omniscience without creation and without action, and all sentient beings are also without creation and without action? The bodhisattva-mahÄsattva dons the armor of the Great Vehicle for this very reason?
The Buddha said:
SubhÅ«ti!
Because the creator cannot be apprehended, the wisdom of omniscience is without creation and without action, and all sentient beings are also without creation and without action.
Why is it so?
SubhÅ«ti!
I am neither created nor not created, neither made nor not made.
Why is it so?
Because I am ultimately unobtainable.

Sentient beings, living beings, born beings, nourished beings, persons, individuals, mind-born beings, young men, agents, instigators, risers, instigators of rising, receivers, instigators of receiving, knowers, and seers are neither created nor not created, neither made nor not made.
Why is it so?
Because sentient beings up to seers are ultimately unobtainable.
SubhÅ«ti!
Illusions are neither created nor not created, neither made nor not made.
Why is it so?
Because illusions are ultimately unobtainable.
Dreams, reflections, echoes, shadows, sky flowers, mirages, cities of gandharvas, and magical creations are neither created nor not created, neither made nor not made.
Why is it so?
Because dream objects, up to and including transformed things, are ultimately unobtainable.
SubhÅ«ti!
Form is neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is this?
Because form is ultimately unobtainable.
Feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is this?
Because feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are ultimately unobtainable.
SubhÅ«ti!
The eye sense base is neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is this?
Because the eye sense base is ultimately unobtainable.
The ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases are neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is this?
Because the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases are ultimately unobtainable.
SubhÅ«ti!
The form sense base is neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is this?
Because the form realm is ultimately unobtainable.
The sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma realms are neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is it so?
Because the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma realms are ultimately unobtainable.
SubhÅ«ti!
The eye realm is neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is it so?
Because the eye realm is ultimately unobtainable.
The form realm, eye consciousness realm, and eye contact, as well as the feelings produced by eye contact as a condition, are neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is it so?
Because the form realm up to eye contact as a condition and the feelings produced are ultimately unobtainable.
SubhÅ«ti!
The ear realm is neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is it so?
Because the ear realm is ultimately unobtainable.
The sound element, ear consciousness element, and ear contact, as well as the feelings that arise from ear contact as a condition, are neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is it so?
Because the sound element up to ear contact as a condition for producing feelings are ultimately unobtainable.
SubhÅ«ti!
The nose element is neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is it so?
Because the nose element is ultimately unobtainable.
The smell element, nose consciousness element, and nose contact, as well as the feelings that arise from nose contact as a condition, are neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is it so?
Because the smell element up to nose contact as a condition for producing feelings are ultimately unobtainable.
SubhÅ«ti!
The tongue element is neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is it so?
Because the tongue element is ultimately unobtainable.

The taste element, tongue consciousness element, and tongue contact, as well as the feelings produced from the conditions of tongue contact, are neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is it so?
Because the taste element up to the feelings produced from the conditions of tongue contact are ultimately non-apprehensible.
SubhÅ«ti!
The body element is neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is it so?
Because the body element is ultimately non-apprehensible.
The touch element, body consciousness element, and body contact, as well as the feelings produced from the conditions of body contact, are neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is it so?
Because the touch element up to the feelings produced from the conditions of body contact are ultimately non-apprehensible.
SubhÅ«ti!
The mind element is neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is it so?
Because the mind element is ultimately non-apprehensible.
The dharma realm, the mental consciousness realm, and the mental contact, and the feelings produced with mental contact as their condition, are neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is it so?
Because the dharma realm up to the feelings produced with mental contact as their condition are ultimately unobtainable.
SubhÅ«ti!
The earth element is neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is it so?
Because the earth element is ultimately unobtainable.
The water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements are neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is it so?
Because the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements are ultimately unobtainable.
SubhÅ«ti!
The noble truth of suffering is neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is it so?
Because the noble truth of suffering is ultimately unobtainable.
The noble truths of the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path are neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is it so?
because the noble truths of accumulation, cessation, and path are ultimately unobtainable.
SubhÅ«ti!
Ignorance is neither created nor not created, neither made nor not made.
Why is it so?
Because ignorance is ultimately unobtainable.

Formations, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress are neither created nor not created, neither made nor not made.
Why is it so?
Because formations up to old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress are ultimately unobtainable.
SubhÅ«ti!
Inner emptiness is neither created nor not created, neither made nor not made.
Why is it so?
Because inner emptiness is ultimately unobtainable.

external emptiness, internal and external emptiness, emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, emptiness of conditioned phenomena, emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, absolute emptiness, emptiness without beginning or end, emptiness of dispersion, emptiness of inherent existence, emptiness of intrinsic nature, emptiness of common characteristics, emptiness of all phenomena, emptiness of non-apprehension, emptiness of nature, emptiness of intrinsic nature, and emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence are neither created nor not created, and neither produced nor not produced.
Why is it so?
Because external emptiness up to the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence are ultimately unobtainable.
SubhÅ«ti!
The four meditative concentrations are neither created nor not created, and neither produced nor not produced.
Why is it so?
Because the four meditative concentrations are ultimately unobtainable.
The four immeasurable [minds] and the four formless concentrations are neither created nor not created, and neither produced nor not produced.
Why is it so?
Because the four immeasurable [minds] and the four formless concentrations are ultimately unobtainable.
SubhÅ«ti!
The four establishments of mindfulness are neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is it so?
Because the four establishments of mindfulness are ultimately unobtainable.

The four right efforts, the four bases of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, and the eightfold noble path are neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is it so?
Because the four right efforts up to the eightfold noble path are ultimately unobtainable.
SubhÅ«ti!
The emptiness liberation gate is neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is it so?
Because the emptiness liberation gate is ultimately unobtainable.
The signless and wishless liberation gates are neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is it so?
Because the signless and wishless liberation gates are ultimately unobtainable.
SubhÅ«ti!
The perfection of generosity is neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is it so?
Because the perfection of generosity is ultimately non-apprehensible.
The perfections of morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom are neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is it so?
Because the perfections of morality up to wisdom are ultimately non-apprehensible.
SubhÅ«ti!
The five eyes are neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is it so?
Because the five eyes are ultimately non-apprehensible.
The six supernormal knowledges are neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is it so?
Because the six supernormal knowledges are ultimately non-apprehensible.
SubhÅ«ti!
The ten powers of the Buddha are neither created nor uncreated, neither made nor unmade.
Why is it so?
Because the ten powers of the Buddha are ultimately non-apprehensible.

the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha, omniscience, the cognition of the path, and the cognition of all aspects are neither created nor not created, and neither done nor not done.
Why is it so?
Because the four fearlessnesses up to the cognition of all aspects are ultimately unobtainable.
SubhÅ«ti!
True suchness is neither created nor not created, and neither done nor not done.
Why is it so?
Because true suchness is ultimately neither not created nor not done.
Why is it so?
Because the dharma realm up to the ultimate reality are ultimately unobtainable.
SubhÅ«ti!
The bodhisattva is neither created nor not created, and neither done nor not done.
Why is it so?
Because the bodhisattva is ultimately unobtainable.
SubhÅ«ti!
The TathÄgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One is neither created nor not created, and neither done nor not done.
Why is it so?
because the TathÄgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One is ultimately unobtainable.
SubhÅ«ti!

For this reason, the cognition of all knowledge is uncreated and unmade, and all sentient beings are also uncreated and unmade. For this matter, the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva dons the armor of the Great Vehicle.
SubhÅ«ti!
For this meaning, the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva does not don the armor of merit. You should know that this is donning the armor of the Great Vehicle.
At that time, the Venerable SubhÅ«ti addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!
As I understand the meaning of what the Buddha has said, form is neither bound nor liberated, and feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness are neither bound nor liberated.
Why is it so?

World-Honored One!ğŸ”½Because the nature of form is non-existent, it is neither bound nor liberated. Because the nature of feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness is non-existent, they are neither bound nor liberated;

Because the nature of form is detached, it is neither bound nor liberated. Because the nature of feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness is detached, they are neither bound nor liberated;

The nature of form is tranquil, so there is no bondage and no liberation; the nature of feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness is tranquil, so there is no bondage and no liberation;

The nature of form is empty, so there is no bondage and no liberation; the nature of feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness is empty, so there is no bondage and no liberation;ğŸ”½The nature of form is signless, so there is no bondage and no liberation; the nature of feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness is signless, so there is no bondage and no liberation;

The nature of form is wishless, so there is no bondage and no liberation; the nature of feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness is wishless, so there is no bondage and no liberation;

The nature of form is unborn, so there is no bondage and no liberation; the nature of feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness is unborn, so there is no bondage and no liberation;ğŸ”½The nature of form is unceasing, so there is no bondage and no liberation; the nature of feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness is unceasing, so there is no bondage and no liberation;

The nature of form is unstained, so there is no bondage and no liberation; the nature of feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness is unstained, so there is no bondage and no liberation;

The nature of form is without purity, therefore it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness is without purity, therefore they are neither bound nor liberated.
World-Honored One!
The eye sense base is neither bound nor liberated, and the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases are also neither bound nor liberated.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One!

The nature of the eye sense base is non-existent, therefore it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases is non-existent, therefore they are neither bound nor liberated;

The nature of the eye sense base is detached, therefore it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases is detached, therefore they are neither bound nor liberated;

The nature of the eye sense base is tranquil, therefore it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases is tranquil, therefore they are neither bound nor liberated;

The nature of the eye sense base is empty, therefore it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases is empty, therefore they are neither bound nor liberated;

The nature of the eye sense base is signless, therefore it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking-mind sense bases is signless, therefore they are neither bound nor liberated.

The nature of the eye sense base is wishless, therefore it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking-mind sense bases is wishless, therefore they are neither bound nor liberated.

The nature of the eye sense base is non-arising, therefore it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking-mind sense bases is non-arising, therefore they are neither bound nor liberated.

The nature of the eye sense base is unceasing, therefore it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking-mind sense bases is unceasing, therefore they are neither bound nor liberated.

The nature of the eye sense base is non-defiled, therefore it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking-mind sense bases is non-defiled, therefore they are neither bound nor liberated.

The nature of the eye sense base is non-purified, therefore it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking-mind sense bases is non-purified, therefore they are neither bound nor liberated.
World-Honored One!
The sphere of form is neither bound nor liberated, and the spheres of sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharmas are also neither bound nor liberated.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One!

Because the nature of the sphere of form does not exist, it is neither bound nor liberated, and because the nature of the spheres of sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharmas does not exist, they are also neither bound nor liberated;

because the nature of the sphere of form is detached, it is neither bound nor liberated, and because the nature of the spheres of sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharmas is detached, they are also neither bound nor liberated;

because the nature of the sphere of form is tranquil, it is neither bound nor liberated, and because the nature of the spheres of sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharmas is tranquil, they are also neither bound nor liberated;

because the nature of the sphere of form is empty, it is neither bound nor liberated, and because the nature of the spheres of sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharmas is empty, they are also neither bound nor liberated;

because the nature of the sphere of form is signless, it is neither bound nor liberated, and because the nature of the spheres of sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharmas is signless, they are also neither bound nor liberated;

The nature of the form realm is wishless, and thus there is no bondage and no liberation. The nature of the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma realms is wishless, and thus there is no bondage and no liberation;

The nature of the form realm is non-arising, and thus there is no bondage and no liberation. The nature of the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma realms is non-arising, and thus there is no bondage and no liberation;ğŸ”½The nature of the form realm is non-ceasing, and thus there is no bondage and no liberation. The nature of the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma realms is non-ceasing, and thus there is no bondage and no liberation;

The nature of the form realm is non-defiled, and thus there is no bondage and no liberation. The nature of the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma realms is non-defiled, and thus there is no bondage and no liberation;

The nature of the form realm is non-purified, and thus there is no bondage and no liberation. The nature of the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma realms is non-purified, and thus there is no bondage and no liberation.
World-Honored One!
The eye realm has no bondage and no liberation, and the form realm, eye consciousness realm, eye contact, and the feelings produced from eye contact as a condition have no bondage and no liberation.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One!

because the nature of the eye element is non-existent, there is no bondage and no liberation; because the nature of the form element, eye consciousness element, eye contact, and the feelings produced from eye contact as a condition is non-existent, there is no bondage and no liberation;

because the nature of the eye element is detached, there is no bondage and no liberation; because the nature of the form element up to eye contact as a condition is detached, there is no bondage and no liberation;ğŸ”½because the nature of the eye element is tranquil, there is no bondage and no liberation; because the nature of the form element up to eye contact as a condition is tranquil, there is no bondage and no liberation;

because the nature of the eye element is empty, there is no bondage and no liberation; because the nature of the form element up to eye contact as a condition is empty, there is no bondage and no liberation;

because the nature of the eye element is signless, there is no bondage and no liberation; because the nature of the form element up to eye contact as a condition is signless, there is no bondage and no liberation;

The eye element is by nature without desire, and thus is neither bound nor liberated. The form element up to the eye contact that is the causal condition for the production of the various feelings is by nature without desire, and thus is neither bound nor liberated.ğŸ”½The eye element is by nature unborn, and thus is neither bound nor liberated. The form element up to the eye contact that is the causal condition for the production of the various feelings is by nature unborn, and thus is neither bound nor liberated.ğŸ”½The eye element is by nature unceasing, and thus is neither bound nor liberated. The form element up to the eye contact that is the causal condition for the production of the various feelings is by nature unceasing, and thus is neither bound nor liberated.

The eye element is by nature unpolluted, and thus is neither bound nor liberated. The form element up to the eye contact that is the causal condition for the production of the various feelings is by nature unpolluted, and thus is neither bound nor liberated.

The eye element is by nature unpurified, and thus is neither bound nor liberated. The form element up to the eye contact that is the causal condition for the production of the various feelings is by nature unpurified, and thus is neither bound nor liberated.
World-Honored One!

The ear element is neither bound nor liberated, and the sound element, ear consciousness element, ear contact, and the feelings that arise from ear contact as a condition are also neither bound nor liberated.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One!

Because the nature of the ear element is non-existent, it is neither bound nor liberated. Because the nature of the sound element, ear consciousness element, ear contact, and the feelings that arise from ear contact as a condition is non-existent, they are also neither bound nor liberated.

Because the nature of the ear element is detached, it is neither bound nor liberated. Because the nature of the sound element up to ear contact as a condition and the feelings that arise from it are detached, they are also neither bound nor liberated.

Because the nature of the ear element is tranquil, it is neither bound nor liberated. Because the nature of the sound element up to ear contact as a condition and the feelings that arise from it are tranquil, they are also neither bound nor liberated.

Because the nature of the ear element is empty, it is neither bound nor liberated. Because the nature of the sound element up to ear contact as a condition and the feelings that arise from it are empty, they are also neither bound nor liberated.

The nature of the ear realm is signless, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the sound realm up to the ear contact that is the condition giving rise to feelings is signless, thus it is neither bound nor liberated;ğŸ”½The nature of the ear realm is wishless, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the sound realm up to the ear contact that is the condition giving rise to feelings is wishless, thus it is neither bound nor liberated;

The nature of the ear realm is non-arising, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the sound realm up to the ear contact that is the condition giving rise to feelings is non-arising, thus it is neither bound nor liberated;

The nature of the ear realm is non-ceasing, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the sound realm up to the ear contact that is the condition giving rise to feelings is non-ceasing, thus it is neither bound nor liberated;ğŸ”½The nature of the ear realm is non-defiled, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the sound realm up to the ear contact that is the condition giving rise to feelings is non-defiled, thus it is neither bound nor liberated;

The nature of the ear realm is non-purified, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the sound realm up to the ear contact that is the condition giving rise to feelings is non-purified, thus it is neither bound nor liberated.
World-Honored One!

The nose realm is unfettered and unfreed, the olfactory world, olfactory consciousness realm, and nose contact, as well as the various feelings produced with nose contact as their condition, are unfettered and unfreed.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One!

Because the nature of the nose realm is non-existent, it is unfettered and unfreed. Because the nature of the olfactory world, olfactory consciousness realm, and nose contact, as well as the various feelings produced with nose contact as their condition, is non-existent, they are unfettered and unfreed;ğŸ”½Because the nature of the nose realm is detached, it is unfettered and unfreed. Because the nature of the olfactory world up to nose contact, as well as the various feelings produced with nose contact as their condition, is detached, they are unfettered and unfreed;

Because the nature of the nose realm is quiescent, it is unfettered and unfreed. Because the nature of the olfactory world up to nose contact, as well as the various feelings produced with nose contact as their condition, is quiescent, they are unfettered and unfreed;

Because the nature of the nose realm is empty, it is unfettered and unfreed. Because the nature of the olfactory world up to nose contact, as well as the various feelings produced with nose contact as their condition, is empty, they are unfettered and unfreed;

The nature of the nose realm is signless, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the olfactory sphere up to the tactile sensations produced by nose-contact is signless, thus it is neither bound nor liberated.ğŸ”½The nature of the nose realm is wishless, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the olfactory sphere up to the tactile sensations produced by nose-contact is wishless, thus it is neither bound nor liberated.

The nature of the nose realm is non-arising, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the olfactory sphere up to the tactile sensations produced by nose-contact is non-arising, thus it is neither bound nor liberated.

The nature of the nose realm is non-ceasing, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the olfactory sphere up to the tactile sensations produced by nose-contact is non-ceasing, thus it is neither bound nor liberated.ğŸ”½The nature of the nose realm is non-defiled, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the olfactory sphere up to the tactile sensations produced by nose-contact is non-defiled, thus it is neither bound nor liberated.

The nature of the nose realm is non-purified, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the olfactory sphere up to the tactile sensations produced by nose-contact is non-purified, thus it is neither bound nor liberated.
World-Honored One!

The tongue sense field is neither bound nor liberated, the taste sense field, tongue consciousness sense field, and the tongue contact and the mental factors produced by the union of those three are also neither bound nor liberated.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One!

Because the nature of the tongue sense field is nonexistent, it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the taste sense field, tongue consciousness sense field, and the tongue contact and the mental factors produced by the union of those three is also nonexistent, so they are neither bound nor liberated;

Because the nature of the tongue sense field is detached, it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the taste sense field up to the tongue contact and the mental factors produced by the union of those three is also detached, so they are neither bound nor liberated;

Because the nature of the tongue sense field is tranquil, it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the taste sense field up to the tongue contact and the mental factors produced by the union of those three is also tranquil, so they are neither bound nor liberated;

Because the nature of the tongue sense field is empty, it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the taste sense field up to the tongue contact and the mental factors produced by the union of those three is also empty, so they are neither bound nor liberated;

The nature of the tongue element is signless, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the taste element up to the tongue contact that is the condition for the arising of the element of sensory experience is signless, thus it is neither bound nor liberated.ğŸ”½The nature of the tongue element is wishless, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the taste element up to the tongue contact that is the condition for the arising of the element of sensory experience is wishless, thus it is neither bound nor liberated.

The nature of the tongue element is non-arising, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the taste element up to the tongue contact that is the condition for the arising of the element of sensory experience is non-arising, thus it is neither bound nor liberated.

The nature of the tongue element is unceasing, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the taste element up to the tongue contact that is the condition for the arising of the element of sensory experience is unceasing, thus it is neither bound nor liberated.

The nature of the tongue element is non-defiled, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the taste element up to the tongue contact that is the condition for the arising of the element of sensory experience is non-defiled, thus it is neither bound nor liberated.

The nature of the tongue element is non-purified, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the taste element up to the tongue contact that is the condition for the arising of the element of sensory experience is non-purified, thus it is neither bound nor liberated.
World-Honored One!

The body element is unfettered and unliberated, and the tactile element, body consciousness element, and the body contact and the bodily sensations produced by the condition of body contact are also unfettered and unliberated.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One!

It is because the nature of the body element is non-existent that it is unfettered and unliberated, and the nature of the tactile element, body consciousness element, and the body contact and the bodily sensations produced by the condition of body contact is also non-existent, so they are unfettered and unliberated;

The nature of the body element is detached, so it is unfettered and unliberated, and the nature of the tactile element up to the bodily sensations produced by the condition of body contact is also detached, so they are unfettered and unliberated;

The nature of the body element is tranquil, so it is unfettered and unliberated, and the nature of the tactile element up to the bodily sensations produced by the condition of body contact is also tranquil, so they are unfettered and unliberated;

The nature of the body element is empty, so it is unfettered and unliberated, and the nature of the tactile element up to the bodily sensations produced by the condition of body contact is also empty, so they are unfettered and unliberated;

The nature of the body element is signless, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the touch element up to the bodily consciousness element and the bodily contact and the feelings produced from it as a condition are signless, thus they are neither bound nor liberated;

The nature of the body element is wishless, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the touch element up to the bodily consciousness element and the bodily contact and the feelings produced from it as a condition are wishless, thus they are neither bound nor liberated;

The nature of the body element is non-arising, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the touch element up to the bodily consciousness element and the bodily contact and the feelings produced from it as a condition are non-arising, thus they are neither bound nor liberated;ğŸ”½The nature of the body element is non-ceasing, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the touch element up to the bodily consciousness element and the bodily contact and the feelings produced from it as a condition are non-ceasing, thus they are neither bound nor liberated;

The nature of the body element is non-defiled, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the touch element up to the bodily consciousness element and the bodily contact and the feelings produced from it as a condition are non-defiled, thus they are neither bound nor liberated;ğŸ”½The nature of the body element is non-purified, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the touch element up to the bodily consciousness element and the bodily contact and the feelings produced from it as a condition are non-purified, thus they are neither bound nor liberated.
World-Honored One!

The sphere of mind is neither bound nor liberated, the sphere of dharmas, the mind consciousness sphere, and the mental contact and the feelings arisen from the conditions of mental contact are also neither bound nor liberated.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One!

It is because the nature of the sphere of mind is non-existent that it is neither bound nor liberated, and the nature of the sphere of dharmas, the mind consciousness sphere, and the mental contact and the feelings arisen from the conditions of mental contact is also non-existent, thus they are neither bound nor liberated;

It is because the nature of the sphere of mind is detached that it is neither bound nor liberated, and the nature of the sphere of dharmas, up to the mental contact and the feelings arisen from the conditions of mental contact is also detached, thus they are neither bound nor liberated;

It is because the nature of the sphere of mind is tranquil that it is neither bound nor liberated, and the nature of the sphere of dharmas, up to the mental contact and the feelings arisen from the conditions of mental contact is also tranquil, thus they are neither bound nor liberated;

It is because the nature of the sphere of mind is empty that it is neither bound nor liberated, and the nature of the sphere of dharmas, up to the mental contact and the feelings arisen from the conditions of mental contact is also empty, thus they are neither bound nor liberated;

The nature of the mind realm is signless, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the dharma realm up to the mental contact that serves as its condition and the feelings produced is signless, thus it is neither bound nor liberated.

The nature of the mind realm is wishless, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the dharma realm up to the mental contact that serves as its condition and the feelings produced is wishless, thus it is neither bound nor liberated.

The nature of the mind realm is non-arising, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the dharma realm up to the mental contact that serves as its condition and the feelings produced is non-arising, thus it is neither bound nor liberated.

The nature of the mind realm is unceasing, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the dharma realm up to the mental contact that serves as its condition and the feelings produced is unceasing, thus it is neither bound nor liberated.ğŸ”½The nature of the mind realm is non-defiled, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the dharma realm up to the mental contact that serves as its condition and the feelings produced is non-defiled, thus it is neither bound nor liberated.

The nature of the mind realm is non-purified, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the dharma realm up to the mental contact that serves as its condition and the feelings produced is non-purified, thus it is neither bound nor liberated.
World-Honored One!
The earth element is neither bound nor liberated, and the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements are also neither bound nor liberated.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One!

Because the nature of the earth element is non-existent, it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements is also non-existent, so they are neither bound nor liberated;ğŸ”½Because the nature of the earth element is detached, it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements is also detached, so they are neither bound nor liberated;

Because the nature of the earth element is tranquil, it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements is also tranquil, so they are neither bound nor liberated;

Because the nature of the earth element is empty, it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements is also empty, so they are neither bound nor liberated;

Because the nature of the earth element is signless, it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements is also signless, so they are neither bound nor liberated;

The nature of the earth element is without bondage or liberation because it is without wishes. The nature of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements is without bondage or liberation because they are without wishes.ğŸ”½The nature of the earth element is without bondage or liberation because it is unborn. The nature of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements is without bondage or liberation because they are unborn.ğŸ”½The nature of the earth element is without bondage or liberation because it is unceasing. The nature of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements is without bondage or liberation because they are unceasing.

The nature of the earth element is without bondage or liberation because it is undefiled. The nature of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements is without bondage or liberation because they are undefiled.

The nature of the earth element is without bondage or liberation because it is unpurified. The nature of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements is without bondage or liberation because they are unpurified.
World-Honored One!
The noble truth of suffering is without bondage or liberation, and the noble truths of the accumulation of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path are also without bondage or liberation.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One!

Because the nature of the noble truth of suffering is non-existent, there is no bondage and no liberation; because the nature of the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path is non-existent, there is no bondage and no liberation;ğŸ”½Because the nature of the noble truth of suffering is detached, there is no bondage and no liberation; because the nature of the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path is detached, there is no bondage and no liberation;

Because the nature of the noble truth of suffering is tranquil, there is no bondage and no liberation; because the nature of the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path is tranquil, there is no bondage and no liberation;

Because the nature of the noble truth of suffering is empty, there is no bondage and no liberation; because the nature of the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path is empty, there is no bondage and no liberation;ğŸ”½Because the nature of the noble truth of suffering is signless, there is no bondage and no liberation; because the nature of the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path is signless, there is no bondage and no liberation;

Because the nature of the noble truth of suffering is wishless, there is no bondage and no liberation; because the nature of the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path is wishless, there is no bondage and no liberation;

The nature of the noble truth of suffering is unborn, and therefore is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path is unborn, and therefore is neither bound nor liberated.ğŸ”½The nature of the noble truth of suffering is unceasing, and therefore is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path is unceasing, and therefore is neither bound nor liberated.

The nature of the noble truth of suffering is unstained, and therefore is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path is unstained, and therefore is neither bound nor liberated.

The nature of the noble truth of suffering is unpurified, and therefore is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the noble truths of the accumulation, cessation, and path is unpurified, and therefore is neither bound nor liberated.
World-Honored One!

Ignorance is neither bound nor liberated, and the activities, consciousness, name-and-form, six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, dejection, and anguish are also neither bound nor liberated.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One!

Because the nature of ignorance is non-existent, there is no bondage and no liberation. Because the nature of karmic formations, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair is non-existent, there is no bondage and no liberation;ğŸ”½Because the nature of ignorance is detached, there is no bondage and no liberation. Because the nature of karmic formations up to old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair is detached, there is no bondage and no liberation;

Because the nature of ignorance is tranquil, there is no bondage and no liberation. Because the nature of karmic formations up to old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair is tranquil, there is no bondage and no liberation;

Because the nature of ignorance is empty, there is no bondage and no liberation. Because the nature of karmic formations up to old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair is empty, there is no bondage and no liberation;

Because the nature of ignorance is signless, there is no bondage and no liberation. Because the nature of karmic formations up to old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair is signless, there is no bondage and no liberation;

The nature of ignorance is without desire, thus it is neither bound nor liberated, and the nature of karmic formations up to old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress is without desire, thus it is neither bound nor liberated;

The nature of ignorance is unborn, thus it is neither bound nor liberated, and the nature of karmic formations up to old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress is unborn, thus it is neither bound nor liberated;

The nature of ignorance is unceasing, thus it is neither bound nor liberated, and the nature of karmic formations up to old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress is unceasing, thus it is neither bound nor liberated;

The nature of ignorance is undefiled, thus it is neither bound nor liberated, and the nature of karmic formations up to old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress is undefiled, thus it is neither bound nor liberated;

The nature of ignorance is unpurified, thus it is neither bound nor liberated, and the nature of karmic formations up to old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress is unpurified, thus it is neither bound nor liberated.
World-Honored One!

The emptiness of internal phenomena is neither bound nor liberated, and the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the great emptiness, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-disputation, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of intrinsic nature, the emptiness of intrinsic identity, the emptiness of all intrinsic identities, and the emptiness of the intrinsic identity of non-entities are also neither bound nor liberated.
Why is it so?
World-Honored One!

Because the nature of the emptiness of internal phenomena is non-existent, it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the great emptiness, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-disputation, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of intrinsic nature, the emptiness of intrinsic identity, the emptiness of all intrinsic identities, and the emptiness of the intrinsic identity of non-entities are all non-existent, so they are neither bound nor liberated;

The nature of inner emptiness is devoid of bondage and liberation because it is far removed, and the nature of outer emptiness up to the emptiness of inherent nature is devoid of bondage and liberation because it is far removed;

The nature of inner emptiness is devoid of bondage and liberation because it is tranquil, and the nature of outer emptiness up to the emptiness of inherent nature is devoid of bondage and liberation because it is tranquil;

The nature of inner emptiness is devoid of bondage and liberation because it is empty, and the nature of outer emptiness up to the emptiness of inherent nature is devoid of bondage and liberation because it is empty;

The nature of inner emptiness is devoid of bondage and liberation because it is signless, and the nature of outer emptiness up to the emptiness of inherent nature is devoid of bondage and liberation because it is signless;ğŸ”½The nature of inner emptiness is devoid of bondage and liberation because it is wishless, and the nature of outer emptiness up to the emptiness of inherent nature is devoid of bondage and liberation because it is wishless;

The nature of inner emptiness is devoid of bondage and liberation because it is non-arising, and the nature of outer emptiness up to the emptiness of inherent nature is devoid of bondage and liberation because it is non-arising;

The nature of inner emptiness has no cessation, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of outer emptiness up to the emptiness of essential nature of non-existence has no cessation, thus it is neither bound nor liberated.ğŸ”½The nature of inner emptiness has no defilement, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of outer emptiness up to the emptiness of essential nature of non-existence has no defilement, thus it is neither bound nor liberated.

The nature of inner emptiness has no purification, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of outer emptiness up to the emptiness of essential nature of non-existence has no purification, thus it is neither bound nor liberated.
World-Honored One!
The four concentrations are neither bound nor liberated, and the four immeasurable [minds] and four formless concentrations are also neither bound nor liberated.
Why is it so?

World-Honored One!ğŸ”½The nature of the four concentrations is non-existent, thus they are neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the four immeasurable [minds] and four formless concentrations is non-existent, thus they are neither bound nor liberated.

The nature of the four concentrations is far removed, thus they are neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the four immeasurable [minds] and four formless concentrations is far removed, thus they are neither bound nor liberated.

The four formless concentrations are by nature tranquil and thus are neither bound nor released; the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations are by nature tranquil and thus are neither bound nor released;

The four formless concentrations are by nature quiescent and thus are neither fettered nor liberated; the four formless concentrations are by nature empty and thus are neither fettered nor liberated;ğŸ”½the four formless concentrations are by nature signless and thus are neither fettered nor liberated; the four formless concentrations are by nature wishless and thus are neither fettered nor liberated;

the four formless concentrations are by nature unconditioned and thus are neither fettered nor liberated; the four formless concentrations are by nature beyond discrimination and thus are neither fettered nor liberated;ğŸ”½the four formless concentrations are by nature beyond conceptualization and thus are neither fettered nor liberated; the four formless concentrations are by nature beyond arising and thus are neither fettered nor liberated;

the four formless concentrations are by nature beyond abiding and thus are neither fettered nor liberated; the four formless concentrations are by nature beyond extinction and thus are neither fettered nor liberated;ğŸ”½the four formless concentrations are by nature beyond defilement and thus are neither fettered nor liberated; the four formless concentrations are by nature beyond purity and thus are neither fettered nor liberated.
The four formless concentrations are by nature undefiled, and so are neither bound nor liberated.
The four formless concentrations are by nature unpurified, and so are neither bound nor liberated.
World-Honored One!

The four establishments of mindfulness are neither bound nor liberated, and the four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of enlightenment, and eightfold noble path are also neither bound nor liberated.
Why is it so?

World-Honored One!ğŸ”½The four establishments of mindfulness are by nature non-existent, and so are neither bound nor liberated, and the four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of enlightenment, and eightfold noble path are by nature non-existent, and so are neither bound nor liberated;

The four establishments of mindfulness are by nature detached, and so are neither bound nor liberated, and the four right efforts, up to the eightfold noble path are by nature detached, and so are neither bound nor liberated;

The four establishments of mindfulness are by nature quiescent and thus are neither bound nor liberated, and the four right efforts up to the eightfold noble path are by nature quiescent and thus are neither bound nor liberated;ğŸ”½the four establishments of mindfulness are by nature empty and thus are neither bound nor liberated, and the four right efforts up to the eightfold noble path are by nature empty and thus are neither bound nor liberated;

the four establishments of mindfulness are by nature signless and thus are neither bound nor liberated, and the four right efforts up to the eightfold noble path are by nature signless and thus are neither bound nor liberated;ğŸ”½the four establishments of mindfulness are by nature wishless and thus are neither bound nor liberated, and the four right efforts up to the eightfold noble path are by nature wishless and thus are neither bound nor liberated;

the four establishments of mindfulness are by nature unborn and thus are neither bound nor liberated, and the four right efforts up to the eightfold noble path are by nature unborn and thus are neither bound nor liberated;

the four establishments of mindfulness are by nature unceasing and thus are neither bound nor liberated, and the four right efforts up to the eightfold noble path are by nature unceasing and thus are neither bound nor liberated;

The nature of the four establishments of mindfulness is unstained, thus it is neither bound nor liberated; the nature of the four right efforts up to the eightfold noble path is unstained, thus it is neither bound nor liberated.

The nature of the four establishments of mindfulness is without purity, thus it is neither bound nor liberated; the nature of the four right efforts up to the eightfold noble path is without purity, thus it is neither bound nor liberated.
World-Honored One!
The emptiness liberation gate is neither bound nor liberated, the signless and wishless liberation gates are neither bound nor liberated.
Why is it so?

World-Honored One!ğŸ”½The nature of the emptiness liberation gate is non-existent, thus it is neither bound nor liberated; the nature of the signless and wishless liberation gates is non-existent, thus it is neither bound nor liberated;ğŸ”½The nature of the emptiness liberation gate is far removed, thus it is neither bound nor liberated; the nature of the signless and wishless liberation gates is far removed, thus it is neither bound nor liberated;

The nature of the emptiness liberation gate is tranquil, thus it is neither bound nor liberated; the nature of the signless and wishless liberation gates is tranquil, thus it is neither bound nor liberated;

The emptiness of the gate of liberation from emptiness is thus signless and unbound and liberated, the emptiness of the signless and wishless gates of liberation is thus signless and unbound and liberated;ğŸ”½The emptiness of the gate of liberation from emptiness is thus wishless and unbound and liberated, the emptiness of the signless and wishless gates of liberation is thus wishless and unbound and liberated;

The emptiness of the gate of liberation from emptiness is thus unborn and unbound and liberated, the emptiness of the signless and wishless gates of liberation is thus unborn and unbound and liberated;ğŸ”½The emptiness of the gate of liberation from emptiness is thus unceasing and unbound and liberated, the emptiness of the signless and wishless gates of liberation is thus unceasing and unbound and liberated;

The emptiness of the gate of liberation from emptiness is thus unstained and unbound and liberated, the emptiness of the signless and wishless gates of liberation is thus unstained and unbound and liberated;

The nature of the emptiness liberation gate is devoid of purity, thus it is neither bound nor liberated. The nature of the signless and wishless liberation gates is devoid of purity, thus they are neither bound nor liberated.Here is the corrected and aligned text:
